ab.title: Numbers 36
ab.l:
And the superiors of the fathers of the families
of the children of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh,
of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near and spoke before
Moses and before the princes — the superiors of the fathers —
of the children of Israel.

And they said,
‘The Lord commanded my lord to give the land for a share by lot
to the children of Israel, and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give
the share of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.

And if they become wives to one of the sons of the tribes
of the children of Israel, then their share will be taken from the share
of our fathers, and will increase the share of the tribe
to which they will belong, and it will be taken from the lot of our share.

And if there be a jubilee of the children of Israel,
then their share will be added to the share
of the tribe to which they will belong, and
their share will be taken from the share of the tribe of our fathers.’

And Moses commanded the children of Israel
according to the word of the Lord, saying, ‘The tribe of the sons
of Joseph has spoken correctly.

This is the word which the Lord commanded
the daughters of Zelophehad, saying,
“They shall become wives for any in whose eyes it is good, only to the family of the tribe
of their father shall they marry.”

So
the share of the children of Israel will not turn from tribe to another
tribe, but the children of Israel shall each cling to the share of the tribe
of his fathers.

And every
daughter who inherits a share from the tribes of the children
of Israel shall be wife to one of the family of the tribe of her father,
so that the children of Israel may inherit
every man the share of his fathers.

And
the share shall not turn from one tribe to another tribe, but the
tribes of the children of Israel shall each cling to its own share.”’

As the Lord commanded Moses, so
the daughters of Zelophehad did:

And
Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters
of Zelophehad, became wives to their uncles’ sons.

They became wives to |members| of the families of the sons of Manasseh,
son of Joseph, and their share remained
on the tribe of the family of their father.

These are the commandments and the judgments which
the Lord commanded by the prophecy of Moses to the children
of Israel in the steppes of Moab by the Jordan of Jericho.
With the help of Him who led his people and spoke and made them find themselves in the wilderness
and fed them with the food of the mighty, with manna instead of grain, the peshatim of the Book of Numbers are completed.
And God makes grass grow on the hills, and he satisfies the needs of all the flesh that live therein.
He will raise me from the dust of my folly, He will enlighten the eyes of my intellect in my writing of the peshatim
of the Book of Deuteronomy.
